title: Indonesia vows to step up trade, but not at any cost
text:
Jakarta | Indonesian Foreign Minister Retno LP Marsudi has nominated economic diplomacy as a priority in the next five years.

In her first major speech since President Joko Widodo last week confirmed she would keep the foreign affairs portfolio in his second-term government, Retno emphasised the importance of economic development and increased investment flow in and out of the country.

Indonesia Foreign Minister Retno Marsud says palm oil is fundamental to the nation's national interests. AP

President Jokowi has set increasing trade and investment as a second-term priority, an acknowledgement that Indonesia needs to broaden the base of an economy dominated by domestic consumption.

Stoking growth has moved up the President's priority list after national GDP growth forecasts were trimed to 5 per cent for 2019, amid warnings from the World Bank and the IMF about damage from the global trade war and a further softening in commodity prices.

Indonesia would pursue bilateral, regional and global diplomacy to strengthen "strategic and mutually beneficial economic co-operation", Retno said. And, in another sign Indonesia's free trade deal with Australia will be ratified soon, the new government has also vowed to accelerate FTA development.
description: Indonesia's re-endorsed foreign minister has pledged to focus on economic diplomacy while snubbing international pressure to reduce production of palm oil.
